Immediately reacts to the danger threatening his mother, shouts warnings, and runs to help her when the ground collapses.

When he recognizes his limits, he calls out to the Monster for help, acknowledging he cannot manage alone.
Shows emotional distress and desperation, some loss of control as his mother slips from his grasp.
Desperately tries to hold on to his mother as she slips away, showing sincere love and care.
Refuses to admit the painful truth that he let his mother go, showing avoidance rather than openness.
Tries desperately to hold onto his mother and refuses to let go despite the pain.
Refuses to face the truth and speak honestly to the Monster even when pressured, showing emotional struggle and hesitation.
Eventually acknowledges internally that he knows the truth he is avoiding, indicating inner awareness.
Admits the painful truth that he let his mother go and expresses his deep emotional suffering and helplessness.
Refuses repeatedly to speak the truth initially, struggling with guilt and fear.
Shows self-punishing thoughts, feeling he deserves punishment and the worst, indicating sincerity and emotional honesty.
Struggles intensely to speak the truth about his feelings, resisting but ultimately admitting painful reality.
Refuses to speak the truth repeatedly, trapped on a precarious shelf above a hole, showing emotional struggle.
Mentally collapses and screams as he admits he let his mother die, showing emotional overwhelm but eventual honesty.
After falling and being caught by the Monster, Conor sits and reflects with sadness and realization about his situation.
Denies the truth multiple times even though it is necessary for his progress and survival.
Admits to feeling alone and conflicted about his mother's impending death, and speaks truthfully about his complex emotions.
Expresses guilt and self-blame for his mother's condition.
Shows exhaustion and confusion about the complexity of human emotions and truths.
Admits his conflicting emotions honestly, expresses grief and confusion openly.
Struggles to fully understand the complexities of truth and human emotions, admits stories 'never made any sense' to him.
Displays vulnerability and doubts his own perceptions but ultimately chooses to speak the truth despite the pain.
Feels overwhelmed and almost willing to die rather than face his painful truth, showing emotional paralysis.
Nestles into the monster’s hands, showing trust and vulnerability.
Responds to Grandma’s urgent concern quietly and complies without argument.
Does not respond immediately to his phone buzzing, ignoring potential disturbance to others.
Internalizes tiredness and emotional exhaustion, not burdening others at that moment.
Takes a long breath and admits exhaustion, showing awareness of his limits.
Questions the Monster about the end of the story, showing curiosity and engagement.
Falls asleep despite phone buzzing and potential urgency, indicating inability to stay alert at a critical moment.
Braces himself to face Grandma and tries to explain his actions, showing emotional resilience and intention to communicate.
Gets quickly overtaken by Grandma and pulled away before finishing explanation, suggesting lack of control over the situation.
Grabs his seatbelt proactively during the dangerous high-speed drive, showing awareness and caution.
Reads and reflects on Lily’s heartfelt note, demonstrating emotional intelligence and maturity.
Attempts to apologize for a prior incident (sitting room) but does so quietly and hesitantly, showing some insecurity.
Engages in honest, calm communication with Grandma during emotional and stressful moments.
Does not respond verbally when Grandma connects them through shared grief (his mother’s illness), yet internally acknowledges it and agrees tacitly.
Agrees to peace talk silently, nodding.
Stands in darkness by doorway not knowing what to do at his mother’s bedside.
Reassures his mother by saying 'I'm here, mum' when urged by Grandma.
Seeks guidance from the Monster, showing vulnerability and trust.
Takes his mother's hand and quietly admits 'I don’t want you to go.'
Leans forward and slips an arm around his mother, holding on to her in a moment of emotional vulnerability.
Takes his mother’s hand and finally speaks the simplest truth out loud, expressing his fear and inability to let go.
Shows emotional vulnerability by quietly admitting he doesn’t want his mother to go and allows himself to cry.
Holds onto his mother and leans into support from the Monster and Grandma, demonstrating an ability to accept help.
Asks the Monster how the fourth story ends, seeking understanding and clarity, indicating thoughtful reflection.
Looks back once at Grandma to make sure it’s okay before entering the loft room.
Engages with his mum’s old sketchpad, showing respect and connection to her memories.
Stops on a drawing of the Monster that looks ominous and powerful, indicating attention to detail and appreciation of the art's impact.
Allows pencils to roll slightly towards the sketchpad, a small lack of physical control and focus in the moment.
Shows a slight private smile while looking at the page, suggesting quiet confidence and internal processing.
